A new 52” Code Compliant Pool Fence Barrier with self-latching gates to  outswing from pool & lock installed at 54” from ground are to be installed. Attached to entrance gates will be a Yard Guard YG03 gate/door water  hazard alarm. Door chirp will be utilized. See line #50 of A&S Contract  Agreement for purchase of gate alarm at time of contract sale. See Fence - Alumn. + Vintage Square uploaded document, pages 4 & 7 for  fencing/spindle details.

Covered Patio with Fireplace. The project consists of removing the existing porch cover, dig new footers and frame a (1) level deck with (2) rectangles. Replace old porch cover with a 28' x 12' shed style roof off the rear and another 16' x 12' shed style roof on the side. Run gas lines for the ventless gas fireplace and electrical for the lights and ceiling fans. Project costs are estimated at $68,375.00.
Extend the gable end of the home to the current position of the carport, enclose as additional home sqft.

Construction of one covered deck at the rear of the home atop an existing concrete paver patio, approx. 468 soft. A secondary deck that is tiered down from the first that will not be covered, approx. 261sqft. Both decks are below 30” in height due to the fall of the grade toward the garage apron, and will only have a drink rail top and the upper deck will be screened. There will be a fireplace at the northern edge of the cover with chimney that extends above the proposed gable cover, it will be no less than 10ft from home and will maintain roofing offset of 3 ft from highest pitch. There will be a natural gas igniter system installed.

Separate permits are required for any electrical, plumbing and gas/mechanical work and are not part of the building permit.  No construction and demolition waste will be stored on the property and such waste shall be disposed of in a clean and sanitary manner by placing it in approved containers and having such waste discarded at an approved landfill.  Signage must be posted pursuant to M.C.L. 16.28.230, including project information signs, which shall be posted in English and Spanish with one double-sided 24  (vertical) × 36  (horizontal) sign posted for every fifty feet of site frontage, with no more than three signs required per street frontage.

Individual single and two-family lot tree density standards apply pursuant to M.C.L. 17.24.100, including at least one two-inch caliper tree for each thirty feet of lot frontage (or portion thereof), excluding alley frontage. Signage must be posted pursuant to M.C.L. 16.28.230, including project information signs, which shall be posted in English and Spanish with one double-sided 24  (vertical) × 36  (horizontal) sign posted for every fifty feet of site frontage, with no more than three signs required per street frontage. No construction and/or demolition waste shall be stored on the property all such waste generated by any and all activities governed by this permit shall be disposed of in an approved landfill. Applicant applied for a self-permit and will act as his/her own general contractor with full responsibility for code compliance, for hiring and employing individuals and subcontractors, and with ultimate responsibility for his/her own work and for the work of others. Acting as his/her general contractor, applicant may forfeit certain protections which might be available to him/her through the State of Tennessee general contractor’s licensing process. Applicant, as a self-build permit holder, is further responsible for requesting all required inspections and completing all authorized work in compliance with applicable adopted codes. Separate permits are required for any electrical, plumbing and gas/mechanical work and are not part of the building permit.

Addition:  Site prep  -Install silt fence.  -Protect existing home finishes.  -Demo and remove existing conditions necessary to build.  -Have addition layout and grade established by surveyor (when necessary)  Excavation  -Excavate, grade and prep for concrete footers and Slab.  Concrete  -Install gravel and drainage.  -Install concrete footers with necessary rebar reinforcement.  -Install concrete slab and trowel finish.  Framing  -Frame basement level walls per plan  -Frame 1st floor system per plan  -Frame exterior walls with door and window openings per plan  -Frame roof system with vaulted ceiling per plan.  -Tie in walls and roof system to existing home per plan.  Roofing  -Install synthetic underlayment, drip edge.  -Install (30 year) Architectural shingles per plan.  -Tie into existing roofing (does not include replacing existing roofing unless specified)  -Install standard 6in gutters and downspouts. (Does not include leaf guards)  Exterior Trim  -Install soffit, fascia, and exterior trim per plan.  Siding  -Install Hardie board & batten siding per plan.  Doors  -Provide and install exterior doors per plan. (See selection budget)  Windows  -Provide and install windows per plan. (See selection budget)  HVAC  -Provide and install ductwork to tie into existing system if the system can support the  additional sq ft. (to be evaluated during preconstruction)  Electrical  -Provide and install subpanel and run power from existing service per plans. (Size of  panel and wire determined by power needs)  Insulation  -Insulate exterior walls and roofline with open cell spray foam.  Painting  -Paint exterior, soffit, facia, trim, and doors. (SW Duration paint or comparable)  -Paint exterior siding. (SW Duration paint or comparable)  Clean up  -Clean up of site provided throughout the project including a final clean at the end.  General Conditions  -Jasper Project management and Superintendent time is billed per hour of time spent  managing the project.

Basic landscaping and a driveway will be installed. Rear setback is 20ft and side setbacks are 5ft unless changed by historical commission.

This permit is one of two. This permit is to create a new dwelling unit on the second level of the existing building creating a duplex. Work per this permit includes: Expand interior walls 6-12 feet towards the back of the parcel and increasing the size of a dormer and turn area into a second unit. This may result in an overhang, but no changes to the footprint of the house. 2-4 windows will be added towards the rear of the home, along with covering the interior stair opening, additional flooring, a kitchen, a bathroom, and two bedroom spaces. Exterior door and stairs will be added, likely above the driveway which would face 1004 Carolyn Ave. 10-15 outlets added, 5-8 overhead lights and ceiling fans in some combination, shower vent, new electric panel and meter will be added. Heat/AC will be via wall unit. Plumber will run pipe for bathroom, kitchen, and washer. No gas will be added to the upstairs. This will add between 180-360 SQFT to the home. Build 16x18 timber frame screen room with wood burning fireplace TO THE REAR OF RESIDENCE.  MHZC must review application. Subdivision Lot: UNIT B HOMES AT 1413 PORTER ROAD AMENDED
Purpose: To construct single family residence with 2301 SF of living space, 281 SF of garage, and 193 SF of porches/decks.    Within Contextual Overlay District, Subject to 17.36.470.

Replace two sets of 7 ft. French doors that lead out to back patio. Replace with taller glass doors and windows. No change in floor plate. Looking to increase natural light and obtain better view of backyard. No trade permits required.

To construct 984 sqft 1 story addition with 210 sqft covered deck off rear of existing single family residence (see plan). 5’ minimum side setback, 20’ minimum rear setback. No second kitchen, to remain single family residence. Not to build over or obstruct easements.

Contact: MTB POOLS LLC  dba River Pools Nashville
Purpose: To install a 15x28 in ground accessory swimming pool to the rear of the residence to comply with IRC codes and state of TN pool alarm laws. See attached on contract showing pool purchase. 10’ min side s/b; 10’ min rear s/b. for every 50’ site frontage, a 24” x 36” d/f must be placed in English and Spanish with information regarding metro council bill 2017-835.

To construct a single-story detached accessory structure with 324 sq ft conditioned space. Not to be constructed over any easements.  5' minimum side and 20' minimum rear setbacks. Not to be used as additional living space/sleeping quarters, detached accessory dwelling unit or for commercial purposes not authorized by the Metro Zoning Code.  Requires Historical Zoning Commission sign-off prior to permit issuance.    THE HOLDER OF THIS PERMIT HEREBY CERTIFIES THAT ALL CONSTRUCTION AND DEMOLITION WASTE WILL BE DISPOSED IN AN APPROVED LANDFILL. THE HOLDER OF THIS PERMIT ALSO CERTIFIES THAT NO CONSTRUCTION OR DEMOLITION WASTE SHALL BE STORED ON THE PROPERTY IN VIOLATION OF ANY PROVISIONS OF THE METROPOLITAN CODE.    FOR EVERY 50 FEET OF SITE FRONTAGE, A DOUBLE-SIDED SIGN 24” X 36” IN SIZE MUST BE POSTED IN ENGLISH AND SPANISH THAT CONTAINS THE INFORMATION REQUIRED BY ORDINANCE NO. 2017-835. NO MORE THAN THREE SIGNS ARE REQUIRED.

To construct unit (C) ,a 3091 sq ft heated and cool single family residence with; and 568.96 sqft garage. 5' min. side setback, 20' min. rear setback. Front setback at a min. of 51  ft.  Not to be over any easements. ***PURSUANT TO ORDINANCE NO 2008-1263 of the Metropolitan Code of Laws, I , holder of this permit, hereby certify that all construction and demolition waste generated by any and all activities governed by this permit shall be disposed of in an approved landfill. Further, I certify that no construction or demolition waste shall be stored on the property in violation of any provisions of the Metropolitan Code* For every 30 feet of street frontage, or fraction thereof, one 2 inch caliper tree as listed in the Urban Forestry approved tree list shall be planted on the subject property.* For every 50 feet of site frontage, a double-sided sign 24” x 36” in size must be posted in English and Spanish that contains the information required by Ordinance No. 2017-835. No more than three signs are required.***

Addition: $186,745 (Note: interior finishes included in other phases) Plans and Permits • Acquire necessary permits and inspections. Site prep • Install silt fence • Protect existing home finishes • Demo and remove existing conditions necessary to build • Have addition layout and grade established by surveyor (when necessary) Excavation • Excavate, grade and prep concrete footers and crawlspace or Slab Concrete • Install gravel and drainage • Install concrete footers with necessary rebar reinforcement • Install concrete slab and trowel finish (Jasper cannot warranty against common hairline cracks due to the nature of concrete) Masonry • Provide and install block foundation wall • Provide and install drainage and waterproofing for foundation wall perimeter • Provide and install brick veneer per plan (see selection budget) Framing • Frame 1st floor system per plan • Frame exterior walls with door and window openings per plan • Frame Roof System with flat ceiling per plan. • Tie in walls and roof system to existing home per plan. Roofing • Install synthetic underlayment, drip edge • Install (30 year) Architectural shingles per plans. • Tie into existing roofing (does not include replacing existing roofing) • Install standard 6” gutters and downspouts. Basically, we will be increasing the size of the existing den, relocating the laundry room, and expanding on the exterior living areas of the home. We will also be giving the front of the home a  face lift  by removing a 2 front door scenario and relocating the front door to the center of the home. The house was once a duplex.  We will be needing to install a temporary culvert from Castleman Drive to the owners front yard, in order to create a parking area for workers and unloading location for material deliveries. There is currently a ditch in front of the home, so we plan to just lay the culvert in place, cover it with gravel, and use it without cutting into the existing grade of the ditch.  The culvert will be comparable in size to the ones on either side of it, that are under the driveways of either side of the subject property.

We will be adding on the rear of the home to increase the size of the existing living room. We will also be adding a new covered screen porch and new deck on the rear of the home. There will be renovations to the exterior of the front elevation of the home as well. We will basically, be giving the front a  face lift  with removing both front doors (this house used to be a duplex) and raising the roof line when we relocate the front door to its new location. We will need to install a culvert for the renovation that will allow subcontractors to park in the front yard instead of the street. The ditch is already there, so we will be putting the temporary culvert in the existing ditch and covering it with gravel. We plan on matching the culvert size to the ones on either side of subject property, so the storm water flow should not be interrupted.

The purpose of the Wagster Mst Closet Addition Project is to construct a 121 sq. ft. mst closet addition in the location of an existing deck. The existing deck will be removed. A new concrete foundation will be poured, 24”x12”, connecting the existing footings. An 8” block foundation wall with brick veneer will be laid to match existing foundation. Floor joist will be 2x10 with ¾” subfloor. Walls will be constructed of 2x4 with ½” O.S.B. sheathing and house wrap. Ceiling joists will be 2x8 – 16” O.C. Rafters will be 2x8 - 16” O.C., with ½” OSB sheathing and 30 yr. Dim shingles. Walls will be insulated with R-13 batt insulation, ceiling with R-33 batt insulation and floor with R-19 batt insulation. Interior of structure will be finished with ½” drywall and painted. Project will take approximately 8 weeks to complete at an estimated cost of $38,645.00.

New single family home of 5,894sqft conditioned space. Three car garage of 824sqft, porches of 756sqft. Total of 7,454sqft under roof.     Two stories with daylight basement.    Mr. Smith:    We did find that this property does meet the conditions for two single-family homes. We can resolve that issue when you re-apply. However, we do see that you haven’t files for an HPR yet.    Parcels must be mapped for an HPR through the Mapping division of the Planning department before applying for a building permit.  An attorney needs to draw up the HPR deeds for unit A, unit B and common area.  Then it will need to be will recorded with the Registrar of Deeds office.  The recorded deed will be taken to the Property Mapping Division of the Planning Department for mapping purposes. Once the mapping has taken place permits can be applied for with Metro Codes.         Feel free to send us any additional or follow up questions.    ZONING HELPDESK – Chuck Cardona   EMAIL: zoninghelpdesk@nashville.gov  PHONE:  615-880-2359

We will be adding a 12' wide, 8' deep covered structure over the existing deck. The covering will not tie into the house for structural support, it will be freestanding with (4) 6 x6  posts in in-ground footings coming through the existing deck. The beams will be 4 x6  beams on all 4 sides. They will meet mitered on top of the notched 6x6 posts with 12  structural screws going straight down from the top of the beam into the posts on each side of the beams. There will also be 4  structural screws going from the notched piece of the posts laterally into the beams. The rafters will be 2 x6  and spaced 12  OC with a (2) 2 x8  ridge beam. The rafters will be tied to the beams with hurricane ties and rafter hangers on the ridge beam. The ridge beam will be supported by a 4 x4  post with metal connectors to the beam and ridge beam. The covering roof will match the existing house roof and the ceilings will be vaulted. There will be flashing from under the house siding out onto the roof of the covered structure.

Total building coverage on parcel not to exceed 40%.Individual single and two-family lot tree density standards apply pursuant to M.C.L. 17.24.100, including at least one two-inch caliper tree for each thirty feet of lot frontage (or portion thereof), excluding alley frontage. Signage must be posted pursuant to M.C.L. 16.28.230, including project information signs, which shall be posted in English and Spanish with one double-sided 24  (vertical) × 36  (horizontal) sign posted for every fifty feet of site frontage, with no more than three signs required per street frontage. No construction and/or demolition waste shall be stored on the property all such waste generated by any and all activities governed by this permit shall be disposed of in an approved landfill.

Shall not exceed three stories or 35' in total height from average finished grade. Must conform to all easements on property. Total building coverage on parcel not to exceed 50%.Individual single and two-family lot tree density standards apply pursuant to M.C.L. 17.24.100, including at least one two-inch caliper tree for each thirty feet of lot frontage (or portion thereof), excluding alley frontage. Signage must be posted pursuant to M.C.L. 16.28.230, including project information signs, which shall be posted in English and Spanish with one double-sided 24  (vertical) × 36  (horizontal) sign posted for every fifty feet of site frontage, with no more than three signs required per street frontage. No construction and/or demolition waste shall be stored on the property all such waste generated by any and all activities governed by this permit shall be disposed of in an approved landfill.
